title: Ronan Farrow cried to boyfriend Jon Lovett when New York Times published Harvey Weinstein expose
text:
Ronan Farrow reveals his surprising reaction when he learned that The New York Times would be publishing their expose on Harvey Weinstein before his own story in the New Yorker.

In his new book Catch and Kill, Farrow writes that he received a call during the first week of October 2017, informing him that Weinstein and attorney and Lisa Bloom were heading to the Times' office in Midtown Manhattan.

The meeting, he was told, was taking place because the paper was set to run its first piece from reporters Jodi Kantor and Megan Twohey.

And that is when an underfed and sleep deprived Farrow broke down in tears.

Scroll down for video

Ronan's rock: Farrow reveals that he learned The New York Times was set to publish its story in early October 2017, before his piece was ready for print (Farrow and boyfriend Jon Lovett above)

Catch and Kill hits bookshelves on Tuesday

'It's good it's breaking,' Farrow recalls telling his boyfriend Jon Lovett.

'It's just - all these months. This whole year. And now I have no job.'

Farrow writes that he then began crying as he told Lovett: 'I swung too wide. I gambled too much. And maybe I won't even have a story at the end of it.'

He then added: 'And I'm letting down all these women.'

Lovett cut Farrow off and urged him to 'calm down,' noting that he had not 'slept or eaten in two weeks.'

And when he later realized the Farrow was calling him while inside a cab, Lovett offered him another piece of advice.

'Oh my God. We are going to talk about this,' said Lovett.

'But first you are going to tip that driver really well.'

Catch and Kill hits bookshelves on Tuesday.
